sentences.en: A fall into the pit, a gain in your wit.
a woman of great wit and charm
sentences.cn: 说话风趣、风韵动人的女人

sentences.en: Alone and penniless, I was forced to live on my wits.
sentences.cn: 孤身一人又身无分文，我只得靠我的机智来过活。

sentences.en: Boulding was known for his biting wit.
sentences.cn: 博尔丁爱说尖酸的俏皮话是出了名的。

sentences.en: He is a man of many words but of little wit.
He needed all his wits to find his way out.
sentences.cn: 他需要绞尽脑汁找到出路。

sentences.en: He was a man of great charm and not inconsiderable wit.
sentences.cn: 他是魅力十足、机智过人的男人。

sentences.en: He was acclaimed for his acerbic wit and repartee.
sentences.cn: 他以一针见血的妙语巧辩而备受好评。

sentences.en: His abrasive wit and caustic comments were an interviewer's nightmare.
sentences.cn: 他睿智刁钻，评论尖刻，对任何采访他的人而言都是梦魇。

sentences.en: His mordant wit appealed to students.
sentences.cn: 他那尖刻的妙语受到学生的欢迎。

sentences.en: Holmes was gregarious, a great wit, a man of wide interests.
sentences.cn: 福尔摩斯爱交际，非常风趣，兴趣广泛。

sentences.en: Julie Burchill is famous for her precocity and rapier wit.
sentences.cn: 朱莉·伯奇尔因其早慧和机敏而闻名。

sentences.en: Ladies and gentlemen paraded their fine manners, wit, and charm.
sentences.cn: 女士们和绅士们卖弄他们的美妙姿态 、 才智和魅力.

sentences.en: Mr Brooke is renowned for his dry wit.
sentences.cn: 布鲁克先生因他不露声色的机智而闻名。

sentences.en: Much of the wit is lost in translation.
sentences.cn: 很多诙谐的成分都在翻译中丢失了。

sentences.en: Our teacher is full of wit when he has a lesson.
sentences.cn: 我们的老师只要讲课就很风趣.

sentences.en: She was known for the quickness of her wit.
The essays could do with a flash of wit or humor.
sentences.cn: 这些散文需要一些出其不意的风趣或幽默。

sentences.en: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.cn: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

phrases.tran_cn: 智穷计尽；全然不知所措
茫然不知所措；智穷计尽

phrases.phrase: be frightened (或 scared) out of one's wits
have (one's) wits about (one) 或 keep (one's) wits about (one)
phrases.tran_cn: 警觉：保持头脑警觉或镇静，尤指在危机时刻

phrases.phrase: have (或 keep) one's wits about one
phrases.tran_cn: 保持机警；保持头脑冷静

trans.tran_cn: 风趣，才思，理解力，智力，明智
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)
